Fixes bug 1213147

The Cisco plugin in grizzly does not pass proper arguments to
the enable_vlan_on_trunk_int() method in cisco_nexus_network_driver_v2.
The definition calls for 4 arguments (not counting self):

    def enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(self, mgr, nexus_switch,
                                 interface, vlanid)

but the call in the nexus driver passes only 3 arguments:

    self._client.enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(man,
                                          port_id,
                                          vlan_id)

Change-Id: Ie51affe692151a2ac92f22450e2e70b1005f3507
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cisco plugin (grizzly) does not pass proper args.

Fixes bug 1213147

The Cisco plugin in grizzly does not pass proper arguments to
the enable_vlan_on_trunk_int() method in cisco_nexus_network_driver_v2.
The definition calls for 4 arguments (not counting self):

    def enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(self, mgr, nexus_switch,
                                 interface, vlanid)

but the call in the nexus driver passes only 3 arguments:

    self._client.enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(man,
                                          port_id,
                                          vlan_id)

Change-Id: Ie51affe692151a2ac92f22450e2e70b1005f3507

for the V3 API in commit 0ef2c55d804e0dab58cb5419a0cafd6a805315c7
and fixes bug 1210529

commit_message:
Add new compute method for building an instance

The run_instance method on the compute manager handles rescheduling of a
failed build by casting back to the scheduler.  In order to maintain
backwards compatibility while modifying the build process to go through
the conductor a new method is being added to co-ordinate building an
instance.

This is one part of a series of patches to build up the
build_and_run_instance method.

The conductor will be switched over to calling this method once it
reaches a level of consistency with the current run_instance method.

Part of bp query-scheduler

Change-Id: I879805efa4a0a045082c02b10926e1278136b72c

subject: VMDK copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-23 12:25:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmware_images.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/io_util.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/volumeops.py', 'cinder/tests/test_vmware_vmdk.py', 'cinder/image/glance.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/read_write_util.py'], 'message': "VMDK copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image

Implemented copy_image_to_volume that creates a new volume backing (vm) and
copies over the vmdk file from the glance image. Only glance images of disk
format 'vmdk' can be used to create a volume using this driver.

Also implemented copy_volume_to_image that creates a new glance image using
the volume's vmdk file. The steps involved are to take a snapshot of volume
vmdk, take a copy of this read only file and upload to glance.

Implements: blueprint vmware-vmdk-cinder-driver
Change-Id: Ice4ec29b480fed2932720cae9adbd2f50d4eb743
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VMDK copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image

Implemented copy_image_to_volume that creates a new volume backing (vm) and
copies over the vmdk file from the glance image. Only glance images of disk
format 'vmdk' can be used to create a volume using this driver.

Also implemented copy_volume_to_image that creates a new glance image using
the volume's vmdk file. The steps involved are to take a snapshot of volume
vmdk, take a copy of this read only file and upload to glance.

Implements: blueprint vmware-vmdk-cinder-driver
Change-Id: Ice4ec29b480fed2932720cae9adbd2f50d4eb743

commit_message:
Fix live migration test for no scheduler running

If we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no
consumers for a topic, the live_migrate() test fails when we attempt
to call() out to scheduler.

Mock up the live_migration() rpcapi and verify it gets called.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Id06a4ff29a0bb4d2caee17576a0ff27bfab4cd87

commit_message:
Fix get_diagnostics() test for no compute consumer

If we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no
consumers for a topic, the get_diagnostics() test fails when we attempt
to call() out to compute.

Mock up the get_diagnostics() rpcapi and verify it gets called.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I4e33d089a9b01ea6dbe31ddf3c67c1733fce10aa

commit_message:
Use Template to instantiate TemplateResource

Use the Template class, rather than the raw template data, to obtain the
information required to create the schema of a TemplateResource facade.
This will allow this feature to work with multiple template formats (e.g.
HOT vs. CloudFormation).

Change-Id: Ifde739b081e95ed9f14567f35a0a1680c5e9b631

[{'created': '2013-08-19 11:42:54.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/xml/flavors_client.py'], 'message': "Fixing format_flavor to handle flavor extra_specs

Flavor detail/show call has extra_specs as a child element in xml.
The parser strips off the namespace before comparing key value pairs.
We need to expect just the key 'extra_specs' without the namespace.

Change-Id: I163d99d08b42aaedeeba377898f23f79153e3ee5
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixing format_flavor to handle flavor extra_specs

Flavor detail/show call has extra_specs as a child element in xml.
The parser strips off the namespace before comparing key value pairs.
We need to expect just the key 'extra_specs' without the namespace.

Fixes bug 1213896

Change-Id: I163d99d08b42aaedeeba377898f23f79153e3ee5

commit_message:
Cleanup: Add common "create volume" method

In scenario tests, there are some "create volume" methods and their
behaviors are almost the same. They create a volume with random name,
size 1GB and wait for volume status "available".
So this patch adds a common "create_volume" method and uses the method
instead of each implementation for code-cleanup.

Change-Id: I06f29a77116fd617f47b0ae6916de933ebb7fdc3

commit_message:
Heat autoscaling scenario test

This test starts with a single server and scales up to
three servers triggered by a script that consumes memory.

Seven minutes after stack creation, memory consumption script
will quit and the scale down alarms will scale back down to
a single server.

Due to the nature of this test, it takes about 10 minutes to
run locally.

The scenario test has been put in package orchestration
for the following reasons:
- this will be the first of many heat scenario tests
- this will allow a tox filter to run this test for the
  slow heat gating job

Change-Id: I53ed12369d12b902108b9b8fa7885df34f6ab51f

commit_message:
(WIP) cli: add messages to assertTrue

---
Trying to backport change I3abba1d9509bee649aa1675beee4153341b1e170
to see if it provides enough info for bug 1213912.

For now with invalid C.Id so it's not connected with
original change (yet).
---

1) Unify assertion of 'usage: service-name' from
   {cinder, glance, keystone, neutron} help tests
   into assertFirstLineStartsWith method, which provides
   more usefull failure message.
2) Add failure message to assertTrue in keystone-catalog
   test.

commit_message:
Stubout reserve_block_device_name() in test

Otherwise it gets called during attach_volume() and fails if we time out
call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I81a8e7fc3c10b6f1ddbec7b1c4ddbbfc9bb45934

Otherwise it gets called during delete() and fails if we time out
call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

commit_message:
Stub out net API sooner in servers API test

Currently we're stubbing out the network API after the controller has
already cached a pristine copy of it.

Without this, validate_networks() fails if we time out call()s in the
fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ia777f964d56678cabb62c1c1dc5db5684ef5dbc0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 02:58:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': 'flake8 H202 error in test_image_utils.py

H202 will detect following case:
self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)

Replace Exception with test.TestingException to pass the H202 checking.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
flake8 H202 error in test_image_utils.py

H202 will detect following case:
self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)

Replace Exception with test.TestingException to pass the H202 checking.

Bug #1214365

Change-Id: Idbd13d11995e6a22e99bb9d63c344a5b1a75f987

commit_message:
To support both CW and CM, return alarmurl from policy ref

This is so we can still have the following:
  AlarmActions:
  - {Ref: ServerScaleUpPolicy}

and use Ceilometer underneath.

The watchrule now tries to look up the resource by
both name and resource_by_refid.

Change-Id: I4759806919ab4f3ccef66698235b23f7f310cb03

subject: GPFS use clone_image for creating volumes
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 23:24:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'GPFS use clone_image for creating volumes

If both source and target of gpfs create volume from image operation
are backed by gpfs storage use clone_image method for implementing
the move of image data to the new volume.

The copy_image_to_volume method is used only if this is not true,
and uses image_utils.fetch_to_raw to move image data to the new
volume.

Fixes bug #1213248

Change-Id: I3958febe67cc86bc3cb608288f7d064f74d3a731
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-19 15:18:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'GPFS use clone_image for creating volumes

If both source and target of gpfs create volume from image operation
are backed by gpfs storage use clone_image method for implementing
the move of image data to the new volume.

The copy_image_to_volume method is used only if this is not true,

commit_message:
GPFS use clone_image for creating volumes

If both source and target of gpfs create volume from image operation
are backed by gpfs storage use clone_image method for implementing
the move of image data to the new volume.

The copy_image_to_volume method is used only if this is not true,
and uses image_utils.fetch_to_raw to move image data to the new
volume.

Fixes bug #1213248

Change-Id: I3958febe67cc86bc3cb608288f7d064f74d3a731

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from cinder.utils

These methods were left over from the split from Nova and are unused still.

Remove methods:
	fetchfile()
	trycmd()
	generate_uid()
	last_octet()
	get_my_linklocal()
	parse_mailmap()
	str_dict_replace()
	flatten_dict()

Change-Id: I5d41dec66246814bb1edb6f4993d5307587a00f9

commit_message:
3PAR driver add missing domain check on QOS cmd

The 3PAR drivers need to support CPGs that are not part of a
virtual domain on the 3PAR backend. This patch now checks
if the domain is set before calling the createvvset command.
This instance was overlooked in the following patch that has
already been merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42697/

Also fixes: bug 1212328

Change-Id: I0375dfc89104775582b9258f18f97c683e6148b1

subject: Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 19:15:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available

Currently if the SolidFire driver is configured but the cluster
isn't available for some reason the ensure_export call will raise
an unhandled exception and crash the volume-service.

We should be able to handle things like loosing connectivity to
a single back-end without impacting the other volume-service
backends.

Rather than raise, we can just sit in a loop waiting for the
SolidFire cluster to come back.

Fixes: bug 1215064

Change-Id: Ice3f517d220c40113074bb77adbb10d5e32abd0b
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-22 17:21:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available

Currently if the SolidFire driver is configured but the cluster
isn't available for some reason the ensure_export call will raise
an unhandled exception and crash the volume-service.

We should be able to handle things like loosing connectivity to
a single back-end without impacting the other volume-service
backends.

We'll wrap the ensure_export call in a try block here and
return None in the case that the connection can't be made.
This will keep the service from crashing and log an error
message that the connection timed out.

Additional work would include adding a periodic retry task
to the manager to try and start the backend service for us
on some regular interval incase the device comes back.

Fixes: bug 1215064

Change-Id: Ice3f517d220c40113074bb77adbb10d5e32abd0b
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-08-22 17:26:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available

isn't available for some reason the ensure_export call will raise
an unhandled exception and crash the volume-service.

We should be able to handle things like loosing connectivity to
a single back-end without impacting the other volume-service
backends.

We'll wrap the ensure_export call in a try block here and
return None in the case that the connection can't be made.
This will keep the service from crashing and log an error
message that the connection timed out.

Additional work would include adding a periodic retry task
to the manager to try and start the backend service for us
on some regular interval incase the device comes back.

Fixes: bug 1215064

Change-Id: Ice3f517d220c40113074bb77adbb10d5e32abd0b
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available

Currently if the SolidFire driver is configured but the cluster
isn't available for some reason the ensure_export call will raise
an unhandled exception and crash the volume-service.

We should be able to handle things like loosing connectivity to
a single back-end without impacting the other volume-service
backends.

We'll wrap the ensure_export call in a try block here and
return None in the case that the connection can't be made.
This will keep the service from crashing and log an error
message that the connection timed out.

Additional work would include adding a periodic retry task
to the manager to try and start the backend service for us
on some regular interval incase the device comes back.

Fixes: bug 1215064

Change-Id: Ice3f517d220c40113074bb77adbb10d5e32abd0b

commit_message:
Move all opens in auth_token to be in context

This commit switches the use of open() to be in a with context. This
will prevent leaking file descriptors because using a context
provides an inherent close(). Prior to this commit it was possible
that an exception or error during the write() call could prevent
close() from running.

Change-Id: Ib13fe651d41f0eafea23a1c96c6c64d405de7e49

subject: Doc: improve doc about Nova measurements
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 09:16:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Doc: clarify the 'cpu_util' measurement.

As explained in bug #1202938, the 'cpu_util' measurement documentation may not
be clear enough. In this patch, we specify that it gives the guest (not the
host) CPU utilisation and that it computes the average utilisation when there
are more than one VCPU (since the measurement is divided by the number of VCPUS
during the 'scale' phase of the transformation).

Change-Id: I69f46b5f82dc0dec2a584ea002dbee19bd55568d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-22 11:58:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/measurements.rst'], 'message': "Doc: improve doc about Nova measurements

As explained in bug #1202938, the 'cpu_util' measurement documentation may not
be clear enough. In this patch, we specify that it returns the average
utilisation when there are more than one VCPU (since the measurement is divided
by the number of VCPUS during the 'scale' phase of the transformation).

We also explicitely state that the Nova measurements return information about
the guests, not the hosts.

Change-Id: I69f46b5f82dc0dec2a584ea002dbee19bd55568d
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Doc: improve doc about Nova measurements

As explained in bug #1202938, the 'cpu_util' measurement documentation may not
be clear enough. In this patch, we specify that it returns the average
utilisation when there are more than one VCPU (since the measurement is divided
by the number of VCPUS during the 'scale' phase of the transformation).

We also explicitely state that the Nova measurements return information about
the guests, not the hosts.

Change-Id: I69f46b5f82dc0dec2a584ea002dbee19bd55568d

commit_message:
unset locking mode for querying IPAllocationPool

Comment #4 of bug 1111572 shows that ip_allocation_pools is a
read-only attribute. So we don't need a lock to query it.

Fixes bug 1215350

subject: use testCase.assert instead of assert and try...except
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 09:09:58.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "use testCase.assert instead of assert and try...except

In unit tests, we should use: self.assertTrue or self.assertFalse
instead of 'assert xxx is True/False', and use self.assertRaises instead
of 'try ... except ...'

fixes bug #1212602

Change-Id: I25318eb59cd26a98afdce5495273e3b3266655a4
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
use testCase.assert instead of assert and try...except

In unit tests, we should use: self.assertTrue or self.assertFalse
instead of 'assert xxx is True/False', and use self.assertRaises instead
of 'try ... except ...'

fixes bug #1212602

Change-Id: I25318eb59cd26a98afdce5495273e3b3266655a4

Fixes bug: #1215132

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-22 23:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/engine/resources/instance.py'], 'message': 'Do not delete nova server on create fail

To keep in line with the behaviour of other resources,

commit_message:
Do not delete nova server on create fail

To keep in line with the behaviour of other resources,
a nova server should only be deleted on resource delete.

Fixes bug: #1215132

Change-Id: Ic478754b7b96001fa0d4110a66d008609de7b482

subject: Do not assume nova provides a fault on ERROR
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 01:40:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not assume nova provides a fault on ERROR

A nova server object in an ERROR state does not
always provide a fault attribute to get the error
reason from.

Fixes bug: #1213285

Change-Id: I861951207cf8fd526a65f768154c76afd0be9081
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-22 23:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/engine/resources/instance.py'], 'message': 'Do not assume nova provides a fault on ERROR

A nova server object in an ERROR state does not
always provide a fault attribute to get the error
reason from.

Fixes bug: #1213285

Change-Id: I861951207cf8fd526a65f768154c76afd0be9081
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Do not assume nova provides a fault on ERROR

A nova server object in an ERROR state does not
always provide a fault attribute to get the error
reason from.

Fixes bug: #1213285

Change-Id: I861951207cf8fd526a65f768154c76afd0be9081

subject: Fix instance metadata access in xenapi
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 21:16:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py'], 'message': 'Fix instance metadata access in xenapi

In preparation for objects, use the helper method in utils to get instance

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix instance metadata access in xenapi

In preparation for objects, use the helper method in utils to get instance
metadata.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I552369937854ec195d1f9abb1835b4e6afef7a70

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 03:52:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds infra for v3 API sample creation

Adds the required infrastructure for the v3 API sample creation.
- v3 API samples and the test cases are in their own v3 directory
- API samples from "core" are now put in their own (per plugin)
  directory rather than in the root directory
- Testcases to create api samples are now placed in individual
  files rather than one giant one. I think it makes it clearer what
  testcases we do have and avoids merge conflict pain

Adds API samples for basic servers interaction

Fix for bug in servers.py where if no extension was loaded which
extends create xml deserialization an exception would occur (fixed
here because it causes the api sample tests ported to fail).

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I653af49dcc499c18f14b6e1764711a9922354069

commit_message:
Adds infra for v3 API sample creation

Adds the required infrastructure for the v3 API sample creation.
- v3 API samples and the test cases are in their own v3 directory
- API samples from "core" are now put in their own (per plugin)
  directory rather than in the root directory
- Testcases to create api samples are now placed in individual
  files rather than one giant one. I think it makes it clearer what
  testcases we do have and avoids merge conflict pain

Adds API samples for basic servers interaction

Fix for bug in servers.py where if no extension was loaded which
extends create xml deserialization an exception would occur (fixed
here because it causes the api sample tests ported to fail).

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I653af49dcc499c18f14b6e1764711a9922354069

Refactor integrated tests to support V2 and V3 API testing Part 2

This changeset moves the APISampleTestBase class out into its own
file so the V3 versions of the tests can cleanly import it separate
from the V2 code.

commit_message:
Set VM back to its original state if cold migration failed

If migration of a VM in the STOPPED state failed due to
NoValidHost, the VM was erroneously set to ACTIVE.

The fix sets the VM back to its original state instead.

Fix bug 1204905

Change-Id: I67ccac9ff4104fbd63c545b9f9399206a7febae7

This should increase template parsing performance by a factor of 9 and
reduce memory usage by an order of magnitude.

We also convert the one test that was directly calling yaml to use the

commit_message:
Convert heat.common.template_format to use C yaml

Will fall back to pyyaml if CSafeLoader/CSafeDumper are not available.
This should increase template parsing performance by a factor of 9 and
reduce memory usage by an order of magnitude.

We also convert the one test that was directly calling yaml to use the
template_format.parse function, so that the same parsing is used
everywhere.

Change-Id: I0d14be2ef7fb2dccac43fc41b1d2d9e4395c6f77
Fixes bug #1214580

commit_message:
Unify code for volume attribute API extensions

There are two files that are copy-pastes of each other for returning
volume attributes. This factors out that common code in both the
implemtation and the tests. There are 2 main reasons for this:
1. Reduce code duplication
2. Reduce the number of DB accesses

Change-Id: Ibb9378f1ca0a40a6c0b92ef5a7e237ddd9d8b63f

commit_message:
Using unicode() to handle image's properties

Replace str() to unicode() to allow nova-api work well with the fix Liu
Zhi Yan did in glanceclient (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29245/6).

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I6bfcaf6d69abcfe7c1d45eae28d77795a7443252
(cherry picked from commit 832a66cf0bd8f7ccb0878889174c1ce4da7f42f3)

commit_message:
Add missing dependencies

Add pbr and d2to1 as dependencies otherwise dpkg will
try to download the packages while building unless
if its explictily added as a build-dependency.

Change-Id: Ibd60a75e24dd491ce70b844761030dcf5ce4a508
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

Add REST API for instance group api extension

Support the Creation, Read, Update, Delete, and List of instance groups.

Change-Id: If411aa1b7bf59d580114efbafd3cb2fe7a55472f
Implements: blueprint instance-group-api-extension

commit_message:
Add api list, match commands

* 'api list' displays various bits about the API versions available in
  the client and on the servers.
* 'api match' tests the matching bits
* useful in debugging api version-related issues

Depends on the restapi support

Change-Id: I02452f62ee0cd698594bbcf90c0654234d86257a

subject: No log handler is set for middleware.auth_token
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 03:06:54.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': 'No log handler is set for middleware.auth_token

run run_tests.sh without argument, it will get following warning:
No handlers could be found for logger "keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"

In class AuthProtocol, there is no handler configured for self.LOG.
add logging.basicConfig() to do basic configuration for logging,
including handler.

After the handler is set, the warning info are exposed, they can be resolved
if necessary.

Fixes Bug #1212472

Change-Id: Ib996c40d3d29f6f0d6e5dbe822f46e90902cb2d4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
No log handler is set for middleware.auth_token

run run_tests.sh without argument, it will get following warning:
No handlers could be found for logger "keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"

In class AuthProtocol, there is no handler configured for self.LOG.
add logging.basicConfig() to do basic configuration for logging,
including handler.

After the handler is set, the warning info are exposed, they can be resolved
if necessary.

Fixes Bug #1212472

Change-Id: Ib996c40d3d29f6f0d6e5dbe822f46e90902cb2d4

commit_message:
Remove "lazy=joined" from the resource_data backref

This is having some weird interaction with the rsrc_metadata column.
In a later patch I add a call to resource_data_set() in signal_responder
and the metadata tests start failing.

Change-Id: Ib59972fe69570f4ae36e672987419f4841a2de40

commit_message:
Implement Fn::MemberListToMap

This is to allow the CloudWatch::Alarm to be implemented as
a resource template. The Dimensions need to be converted
from [{Name: bla, Value: foo}] into a normal dict.

So we define the Dimensions as a CommaDelimitedList in the template,
then in TemplateResource we see that the property is a list of dicts
and convert it into the aws style memberlist
 '.member.0.Name=bla,.member.0.Value=green'
then in the CW template we can do the following:

matching_metadata:
  "Fn::MemberListToMap": [Name, Value, {"Fn::   Split": [",",
{Ref: Dimensions}]}]

Note: this in not a single case usage as we can use this for the Tags
property that is in a lot of other resources.

Change-Id: I68910c51eaeb0857531028e87b89b9192db4c8ba

commit_message:
Handle InstanceInvalidState of soft_delete

Since commit 99c51e34230394cadf0b82e364ea10c38e193979, instance
is not able to be soft_deleted if instance has never been active.
But there are circumstances when instance fails on initial build.
Thus if we set reclaim_instance_interval in nova.conf, we cannot
delete such instances in any way.

This patch fixes this by handling InstanceInvalidState exception
when try to soft_delete instance. The delete() function is called
for instance which has never been active.

Bug 1202158

Change-Id: I7d0d9414d7436e56b6a3e5861ee3c2f02473df2b

commit_message:
xenapi: refactor - extract get_virtual_size

This change extracts a function get_virtual_size. This is needed,
because we would like to support tar.gz files, in which case the image's
virtual size will be determined by looking at the tar.gz stream. The
first tarinfo will tell us the size.

related to blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: If34bb8849ad2dacf471f1bec5e72a37ddda79464

commit_message:
glance-replicator: enable logging exceptions into log file

bug 1213779

Currently, glance-replicator provides option to enable logging
information into a specified file. But exceptions are not logged
into the log file when they are thrown.

Reproduce steps:

When setting a wrong source or target address, exceptions would be
thrown, but not logged into log file.

Change-Id: Ic2c59e04aa6099f3ede0c6b8579c31a3dfff895c

commit_message:
Add netaddr to test-requirements

Because of the way we do old keystoneclient tests we depend on
keystoneclient without actually installing it. Therefore we need to have
keystoneclient's requirements met in our test-requirements.

Fixes: bug 1212939
Change-Id: I25eca24c6820611a5937a1f709ba42620b70b304

commit_message:
Fix bug by passing correct number of arguments

* nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py:
  (LibvirtDriver.attach_interface,
   LibvirtDriver.detach_interface): Pass correct number of arguments.

* nova/tests/virt/test_virt_drivers.py:
  (_VirtDriverTestCase.test_attach_detach_interface): New test.

* nova/compute/manager.py,
  nova/virt/fake.py:
  (ComputeManager.attach_interface, ComputeManager.detach_interface,
   FakeDriver.attach_interface, FakeDriver.detach_interface):
    Update to use nova.network.model instead of legacy
    "network, mapping" tuple.

Partly implement blueprint nova-network-legacy
Closes-Bug: 1210203
Change-Id: Ic50eed9aaebdfc833a89e8c9574a2772574a8154

commit_message:
Limit maximum size of all templates

Templates of an extremely large size can eat up tons of CPU time,
memory and storage. By refusing to parse any template over a certain
size, we can prevent users from abusing the service.

Fixes bug #1214234

Change-Id: I2f731c8e2fc9e1f497199e310de81fa48c9582af

commit_message:
Refactor cinder/tests/test_volume.py

Refactor test_volume.py to remove code duplication.
- remove iterant definition of the 'expected' dict from
'test_create_delete_volume' and 'test_create_delete_snapshot'
method;
- move 'test_copy_volume_to_image_status_available',
'test_copy_volume_to_image_status_use' and
'test_copy_volume_to_image_exception' methods to new class
 CopyVolumeToImageTestCase;
- move 'test_volume_get_active_by_window' and
'test_snapshot_get_active_by_window' to new class
GetActiveByWindowTestCase;
- create base class BaseVolumeTestCase for TestCase classes.
bp cinder-tests-improvement

Change-Id: I5d3644375d321e613418ea8e544557d33401ff77

commit_message:
Allow configure the number of http retries

Allow setting the maximum number of times we want to retry to
http_connect when communicating with the Identity service.

Closes-Bug: 1209194

commit_message:
Migrating ec2 credentials to credential.

Merging ec2 credentials into the credentials
table to simplify management of ec2
credentials.

blueprint migrate-ec2-credentials

commit_message:
Stub out more net API methods floating IP DNS test

Otherwise e.g. create_public_dns_domain() fails if we time out call()s
in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I44455fa23c4b0e4026414d74379361de0576cbeb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:14:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enable CastAsCall for test_api_samples

Like the EC2 tests, the API sample tests are pretty much full-on
integration tests.

However, unlike the EC2 tests, the API tests currently don't use
CastAsCall. Without CastAsCall enabled, it seems that a bunch of issues
are masked simply because the test exits before some RPC casts ever get
executed.

The previous commits fix the cases where CastAsCall causes a failure.
This commit just enables it. Hopefully, it will ensure issues don't get
masked in future.

blueprint: oslo-messaging

commit_message:
Enable CastAsCall for test_api_samples

Like the EC2 tests, the API sample tests are pretty much full-on
integration tests.

However, unlike the EC2 tests, the API tests currently don't use
CastAsCall. Without CastAsCall enabled, it seems that a bunch of issues
are masked simply because the test exits before some RPC casts ever get
executed.

The previous commits fix the cases where CastAsCall causes a failure.
This commit just enables it. Hopefully, it will ensure issues don't get
masked in future.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ib01797cec76c7cb3298808636e1b27fec4175594

commit_message:
Stub out attach_volume() in test_api_samples

If you enable CastToCall, the attach_volume_to_server() test fails when
it attempts to connect to cinder (i.e. initialize_connection()).

Best thing is to just stub out the attach_volume() call.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I75f4e3fd1ecd0635867c167872a8eb7606cf295e

subject: Fix remove_fixed_ip test with CastAsCall
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:14:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix remove_fixed_ip test with CastAsCall

If you enable CastAsCall, a bunch of issues with the remove_fixed_ip
API sample integration test crops up.

Firstly, the sample network is getting created with 'fake-mini' from
CONF.host as the network host rather than the host UUID generated for
the network service in start_service(). This results in
allocate_fixed_ip() attempting to invoke an RPC on a non-existant host.

Secondly, the test is attempting to remove a fixed IP which was never
allocated. Use the add_fixed_ip() test to allocate a fixed IP and then
remove that one, which is 10.0.0.3 rather than 10.0.0.2 which is the
IP reserved for VPN.

Lastly, disable the instance DNS manager because it seems this isn't
compatible with multinic. I was getting FloatingIpDNSExists raised.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Related-Bug: #1213251
Change-Id: I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d

allocated. Use the add_fixed_ip() test to allocate a fixed IP and then
remove that one, which is 10.0.0.3 rather than 10.0.0.2 which is the
IP reserved for VPN.

Lastly, disable the instance DNS manager because it seems this isn't
compatible with multinic. I was getting FloatingIpDNSExists raised.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Related-Bug: #1213251
Change-Id: I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d

commit_message:
Fix remove_fixed_ip test with CastAsCall

If you enable CastAsCall, a bunch of issues with the remove_fixed_ip
API sample integration test crops up.

Firstly, the sample network is getting created with 'fake-mini' from
CONF.host as the network host rather than the host UUID generated for
the network service in start_service(). This results in
allocate_fixed_ip() attempting to invoke an RPC on a non-existant host.

Secondly, the test is attempting to remove a fixed IP which was never
allocated. Use the add_fixed_ip() test to allocate a fixed IP and then
remove that one, which is 10.0.0.3 rather than 10.0.0.2 which is the
IP reserved for VPN.

Lastly, disable the instance DNS manager because it seems this isn't
compatible with multinic. I was getting FloatingIpDNSExists raised.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Related-Bug: #1213251
Change-Id: I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d

commit_message:
Allow name argument to flavor-access-add

Administrator cannot use the flavor name in arguments of
"nova flavor-access-add" and "nova flavor-access-remove"
in following conditions.

1. The flavor is non-public.
2. The falvor doesn't belong administrator's tenant.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ic5e3222d0ff62667e003a61e6a94e85833da5d11
Fixes: bug #1205298

commit_message:
Allow volume create from source unless in error status

This patch restores the source volume status checking behavior
to allow create_volume function to proceed unless it is in
error status. In FibreChannel attached environment, it is typical
to have a volume attached before the volume clone starts. The
operating system owns the volume will ensure the consistency.

Fixes: bug #1214235
Change-Id: Ie639f2f36e2939399303ca0658c169124801e86b

commit_message:
Pass the previous stack to StackUpdate

This starts out like the existing stack, but is not stored in the database
or updated as the stack update proceeds. This allows the StackUpdate object
to store any information that might be relevant to a future rollback.

Change-Id: I94f0dd69b5e7818f811c8c0d50566a79b81acba7

commit_message:
Backup driver for IBM Tivoli Storage manager (TSM)

An implementation of Cinder backup driver using TSM as a backend for
Cinder backups. The driver is a wrapper for the TSM command line
utility dsmc, and uses TSM image backup and restore.

Re-added make_dev_path from cinder/utils.py which was removed by commit
d65425453d215ad64e2bf31b66a3b613c6e7f879

Change-Id: Id105c91ffd3ca953a9fc67dc13f31c3b885bccd7

commit_message:
Add root_helper param to get_connector_properties

This patch adds the ability to pass in a custom
root_helper for executing commands.  This is needed
for other projects that need a custom root-wrapper,
such as nova.

fixes Bug #1213135

Change-Id: Ie18276ae2e736bb2276d4e9c57385d2588441428

commit_message:
Implement hard reboot for powervm driver

Implements the OS reboot API in the powervm driver. Soft reboot is not
supported as it requires additional configuration on the LPAR when it's
spawned so this patch simply performs an immediate hard reboot.

Also adds tests for start_lpar and stop_lpar which didn't exist before.

Closes-Bug: #1205089

Change-Id: Iad64dda79f46d18c7aa5bee12ed41e7a01853d34

commit_message:
Make dependency on netaddr optional

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/38023/ pointed out that
the dependency on netaddr is unnecessary and can be avoided.
Use try_import to avoid a hard dependency on netaddr.

Change-Id: I8b246f20f9001379fcb5ca3a84aabee3847cb945

commit_message:
ceilometer-agent-compute did not catch exception for disk error

When get instance disk info, ceilometer-agent-compute did not
catch exception if failed to get disk info caused by libvirt
error.

The fix was enable the exception handling for such case.

Fix bug 1209509

Change-Id: Ibcdcf3a7490a60b654f09e8aba487200e0c1d8fa

commit_message:
xenapi: refactor - extract get_stream_funct_for

This change extracts the get_stream_funct_for function. As we would like
to support tar.gz compressed raw images, the stream function for them
should be different from the plain ones.

related to blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: I27681da069ba2cd23670ef41f54ed9ac5af31ae6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-31 10:14:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "move fast-post meta key filtering to obj.diskfile

The object-server 'allowed_headers' attribute is defined by config, but
limited by the metadata keys that should not be updated via fast POST.  Since
the diskfile class manages the merging of data_file and meta_file keys it
is the defacto Single Source of Truth for which metadata keys should NOT be
allowed to update via fast-POST.

Because fast-POST if not commonly used anymore, I tried to be very specific
about the role of the constant by renaming it from DISALLOWED_HEADERS
(presumably meaning headers that should not be passed into write_metadata) to
DISALLOWED_META_FILE_UPDATE_KEYS (meaning metadata that should not be passed
into the method that updates the meta_file).

Change-Id: I4bdfc1e4813a1d27fe726ba83481c6e7194aab7f

commit_message:
change .data vrs .meta file metadata filtering in obj.diskfile

Add DATAFILE_SYSTEM_META to diskfile.py which is a set of
system-set metadata keys that cannot be changed with a POST.

Fixes: bug #1214607

commit_message:
Make the length of a line logged configurable

Failed calls to rysnc can
  result in very long log lines.

These lines are
  mostly made up
of file paths and are
  not always useful.

This change will
  allow for reducing the
length of these
  lines logged if desired.

Change-Id: I9a28f19eadc07757da9d42b0d7be1ed82170d732

subject: Fix range GET w/If-None-Match.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 23:07:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Fix range GET w/If-None-Match.

An object GET request with both If-None-Match: <Etag> and
Range: bytes=N-M should result in a 304 Not Modified if the Etag
matches. However, it was resulting in a 416 Requested Range Not
Satisfiable. This commit fixes that.

The fix was to remove conditional_response=True from a request in the
proxy. As far as I can see, the only effect that
conditional_response=True has in swob is to enable range
checking. Since the object server handles all the range stuff, the
proxy shouldn't do it. Otherwise, you wind up with double-application
of the Range header, and that doesn't work very well.

This is probably left over from the WebOb days.

Fixes bug #1196805.

Change-Id: I207f3839731b7503baa3fdbd7cd1cfe3e1b46f62
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix range GET w/If-None-Match.

An object GET request with both If-None-Match: <Etag> and
Range: bytes=N-M should result in a 304 Not Modified if the Etag
matches. However, it was resulting in a 416 Requested Range Not
Satisfiable. This commit fixes that.

The fix was to remove conditional_response=True from a request in the
proxy. As far as I can see, the only effect that
conditional_response=True has in swob is to enable range
checking. Since the object server handles all the range stuff, the
proxy shouldn't do it. Otherwise, you wind up with double-application
of the Range header, and that doesn't work very well.

This is probably left over from the WebOb days.

Fixes bug #1196805.

Change-Id: I207f3839731b7503baa3fdbd7cd1cfe3e1b46f62

commit_message:
Configuration Reference additions.

Moves some items to ops guide, one item to install, updates the
pom.xml, ensures validation, removes whitespace.

Moves all configuration info in Block Storage Admin Guide to Config Ref.

Removes duplicated content from Compute Admin Guide to Config Ref.

Change-Id: I0a7fb144241be7acf7c9063e5290220b5d7b7192

commit_message:
Add add_aggregate_to_host() to FakeDriver

AggregatesSampleJsonTest.test_add_host fails if you enable CastToCall on
test_api_samples because FakeDriver doesn't have stub implementations
of add_aggregate_to_host() or remove_aggregate_from_host().

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I6089e174fc12222bd823ab59adf246190346a401

commit_message:
Fix python 3 pep8 errors for print

The new auto-pulled requirements files exposed
python 3 compat issues in a number of modules.
We added these to tox.ini ignore temporarily,
this change updates the print routines in bin/cinder
and removes the debug cruft that was in the unit tests.

Will update requirements and test-requirements
appropriately in a follow up patch.

Change-Id: I76ea24f4dc1f61c4f8a1d202b0554c90daf2c9cc

The keystone class provides UUID and PKI token formats, but does
not provide the ability to manage SSL.  This patch introduces the
enable_ssl parameter that allows users to enable and disable SSL.

Defaults to true for backwards compatibility and to enable SSL.

Based on the following master branch patch:

enable_ssl parameter that allows users to enable and disable SSL.

commit_message:
Adds Support to Manage SSL

The keystone class provides UUID and PKI token formats, but does
not provide the ability to manage SSL.  This patch introduces the
enable_ssl parameter that allows users to enable and disable SSL.

Defaults to true for backwards compatibility and to enable SSL.

Based on the following master branch patch:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39205/

Had to address a cherry-pick conflict by adding a } to line 137

Change-Id: If11e3eccf145b5f87e6c8979f42665577e35b50b

commit_message:
Enable H302 check

This patch replaces some method imports with module imports and
makes H302 test enabled.

Fixes bug 1188531

Change-Id: Ibfbddeaa19cbbb244da58ffd5c918c41f03a0c65

commit_message:
Log exception details setting vm_state to error

This commit switches to LOG.exception() for exceptions that trigger
setting an instance into an error vm_state. Prior to this commit just
an error message was printed which provided no context for debugging
an actual failure. By switching to LOG.exception() instead of
LOG.error() a traceback will be printed to show where the exception
came from.

Fixes bug 1215068

Change-Id: If3aaf3d8ec61c3e902c299f3e5889dcafa144a9a

commit_message:
Cisco plugin (grizzly) device connection errors

This commit fixes the Cisco plugin device connections issue where the plugin would drop
connections to the Nexus switches.

Change-Id: I9f09d22cb359b4fcdae5f5063a97011d82daf5a1
Fixes: Bug 1212834

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 19:05:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py'], 'message': 'Fix IVS vif to correctly delete interfaces on unplug

The IVS unplug method was incorrectly calling the OVS
specific interface removal methods. This corrects it
to call the IVS removal methods.

Fixes: bug #1214532
Change-Id: Ie718e167d5bdcfae0d915ef85976aeeb3449ad18
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix IVS vif to correctly delete interfaces on unplug

The IVS unplug method was incorrectly calling the OVS
specific interface removal methods. This corrects it
to call the IVS removal methods.

Fixes: bug #1214532
Change-Id: Ie718e167d5bdcfae0d915ef85976aeeb3449ad18

commit_message:
Fix api samples image service stub

If you enable CastAsCall with test_api_samples, test_post_backup_server
fails because the ImageService.detail() method returns None and you
get:

  TypeError: object of type 'NoneType' has no len()

Fix by returning an empty list.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I0cc413d6d428caebb1f67cbc701a36227dead567

subject: Add CastAsCall fixture
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:14:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add CastAsCall fixture

In Ia7f40718533e450f00cd3e7d753ac65755c70588 we made the EC2 integration
tests treat all RPC cast()s as call()s. The idea being that rather than
insert sleeps in the tests to ensure that a cast()ed operation is
completed before we continue, we instead just do the operation with
call() and thereby block until it is completed.

If we take a step back, the approach is questionable - if there's no way
for us to block on the completion of an async task in our unit tests,
what hope do users have?

But, it is a sweet little hack, and is better than sleeping in tests.

With oslo.messaging, it will be both harder to implement this hack and
seemingly needed more often. Encode the hack as a fixture so it can be
easily re-used.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I5f9e74f46e347594103484460e81da46835eeb7e

commit_message:
Add CastAsCall fixture

In Ia7f40718533e450f00cd3e7d753ac65755c70588 we made the EC2 integration
tests treat all RPC cast()s as call()s. The idea being that rather than
insert sleeps in the tests to ensure that a cast()ed operation is
completed before we continue, we instead just do the operation with
call() and thereby block until it is completed.

If we take a step back, the approach is questionable - if there's no way
for us to block on the completion of an async task in our unit tests,
what hope do users have?

But, it is a sweet little hack, and is better than sleeping in tests.

With oslo.messaging, it will be both harder to implement this hack and
seemingly needed more often. Encode the hack as a fixture so it can be
easily re-used.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I5f9e74f46e347594103484460e81da46835eeb7e

commit_message:
Enable consoleauth service during ec2 tests

Otherwise delete_tokens_for_instance() fails if we time out calls()
in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Id27f20144bc3dc273d72b2dad59c94bddd61f03f

commit_message:
Disable periodic tasks during integration tests

While debugging various test failures, I was confused several times by
weirdness caused by periodic tasks running during the tests.

It doesn't seem to make much sense to allow this to happen, even if it
doesn't appear to affect the tests.

Change-Id: I75d34b5ee2bf76b64ae8ba108d9c78b741ce4574

commit_message:
Use ExceptionHelper to bypass @client_exceptions

Rather than stubbing out catch_client_exception() to bypass the wrapping
of exceptions in ClientException, use the existing ExceptionHelper to do
it.

This is import for oslo.messaging, because there's no public API method
for us to stub out.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I32c83ef15fece35526739c4fcdfccf7a275c7033

1) single field, "user-id"
2) single field, "resource-id"
3) single field, "project-id"
4) single field, "source"
5) single field, metadata (not yet implemented)
6) multiple regular fields
7) multiple metadata fields (not yet implemented)
8) multiple fields, regular and metadata (not yet implemented)

commit_message:
Add SQLAlchemy implementation of groupby

Implements: blueprint api-group-by

New class StatisticsGroupByTest contains the storage tests for group by
statistics and has its own test data

The storage tests check group by statistics for
 1) single field, "user-id"
 2) single field, "resource-id"
 3) single field, "project-id"
 4) single field, "source"
 5) single metadata field (not yet implemented)
 6) multiple fields
 7) multiple metadata fields (not yet implemented)
 8) multiple mixed fields, regular and metadata (not yet implemented)
 9) single field groupby with query filter
10) single metadata field groupby with query filter (not yet implemented)
11) multiple field group by with multiple query filters
12) multiple metadata field group by with multiple query filters
    (not yet implemented)
13) single field with period
14) single metadata field with period (not yet implemented)
15) single field with query filter and period
16) single metadata field with query filter and period (not yet implemented)

It also includes the implementation for the SQLAlchemy driver.

Change-Id: I902db657e424b9894c0382db4869b22317fc25da

commit_message:
Add missing content type and encoding business logic after MIME-type revamp.

The intial work on the MIME-type revamp addressed most of the content-type/encoding
and accept/accept-encoding work flows, but there were some flows that weren't addressed,
including some corner cases such as dealing with all the flavors of 'text/plain' that
clients can send to Barbican. This commit set also reorganizes some of the business
logic sections to enable better unit testing of this somewhat complicated workflow.

Change-Id: I091f33bfe1515a3faa13024536745d8fed68604a

commit_message:
Move tests back to neutronclient package

Neutron itself has all of its tests in neutron/tests, as do 2/3 of
the projects in OpenStack. There are a wealth of reasons to put
them in the package, not the least of which that tests/__init__.py
implies a code living in a global namespace called tests.

Change-Id: I2aaacfe59d6790648aa4587e89e6dd28a9149a6c

commit_message:
Merge duplicate repo description in one that can be shared

The repository setup is the same for all three nodes - and needs
updates for every release. So, let's have it only once in a common
section and reference it from other places.

I've also fixed markup of the shared part.

Change-Id: I5d2b96744a1bcfa9cb11f60c8bae5bd0ee076ede

commit_message:
chore: cleanup the unit tests with ddt

ddt stands for data-driven-tests, and it's also a Python module.
It adds the test data as a decorator to the test methods, so that
the test code can focus on each type of behaviors instead of using
`for` loops internally (on the other hand, you have to split big
tests which testing different types of behaviors into small tests).

Change-Id: I1cba67c15e9bb6e5e73e26a11e08fb1390a0504a

commit_message:
Update requirements

This is the fabulous result of running the update.py script from
openstack/requirements with this repository as the target. It therefore
updates all dependencies, with nice version numbers that this repository
have to use to work. It also fixes case on some dependencies.
This update also brings a brand shiny new setup.py automatically handled
and generate by this same openstack/requirements repository.

Due to some changes somewhere, testr configuration has to be modified,
and I actually fixed and simplified a bit to make tests ran.

Change-Id: Ibbea49fbc98caa6a175e9174243ab66a753493f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 14:19:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix logic in add_host_to_aggregate()

Commit I788782a9f21ec2672551f75123753175bb268586 introduced some
changes into the add_host_to_aggregate() method to catch adding an
host to an availability zone when the host was already a member of
a different availability zone. However there were a couple of issues
with this change. There was no check that the availability_zone was
in the metadata grabbed from the database which would raise a
KeyError back to the api. Additionally, the check wouldn't always
work as expected because the database returned a set of availability
zones (including sometimes an empty set) so the check would fail in
some conditions when it was expected to pass.

This commit fixes the logic for checking if the host is already in an
availability zone. It also replaces the try/except block in the
aggregates extension to check up front if the action is valid instead
of waiting for a key error when it goes to use the action.

Fixes bug 1208627
Fixes bug 1208628

Change-Id: I81b79602e23e78c8b077d313e556796de1255bbf

commit_message:
Fix logic in add_host_to_aggregate()

Commit I788782a9f21ec2672551f75123753175bb268586 introduced some
changes into the add_host_to_aggregate() method to catch adding an
host to an availability zone when the host was already a member of
a different availability zone. However there were a couple of issues
with this change. There was no check that the availability_zone was
in the metadata grabbed from the database which would raise a
KeyError back to the api. Additionally, the check wouldn't always
work as expected because the database returned a set of availability
zones (including sometimes an empty set) so the check would fail in
some conditions when it was expected to pass.

This commit fixes the logic for checking if the host is already in an
availability zone. It also replaces the try/except block in the
aggregates extension to check up front if the action is valid instead
of waiting for a key error when it goes to use the action.

Fixes bug 1208627
Fixes bug 1208628

Change-Id: I81b79602e23e78c8b077d313e556796de1255bbf

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-09 14:44:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use new BDM syntax when determining boot metadata.

This patch makes it possible to use new BDM syntax (if it was used in
the request when booting) to be used when determining where to get the
metadata from.

Since the new syntax has the boot_index field - it is easy to determine
which device is intended to be booted from.

This patch was authored by Xavier Queralt <xqueralt@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If92c9df261880eb0dcf0fd0a81fd1ae7c688d201
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

commit_message:
Use new BDM syntax when determining boot metadata

This patch makes it possible to use new BDM syntax (if it was used in
the request when booting) to be used when determining where to get the
metadata from.

Since the new syntax has the boot_index field - it is easy to determine
which device is intended to be booted from.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Co-authored-by: Xavier Queralt <xqueralt@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If92c9df261880eb0dcf0fd0a81fd1ae7c688d201

commit_message:
Allow more than one ephemeral device in the DB

This patch changes the database api behaviour when creating/updating a
block device mapping to allow more than one ephemeral device instead of
overriding the old ones.

Part of blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I71c283cbd5ad3d28a27d06cb01b5ba9433f8ab46

commit_message:
Change datagrid field to work with units templates.

Now datagrid uses dcInstances value converted to units (though, still 2 hacks
are needed - to JSON-stringify input data and destringify output data). This seems
appropriate to be done, when we will throw away djblets package.

Datagrid uses data from another form as initial data (thus make useful MRN-831).

Also one change is made to unitTemplates data: every occurrence of '#' in strings
is replaced with current unit 1-based index, as in unitNamingPattern.

Change-Id: I283a67e437d1495257e4c39b18e558072875ffea

subject: Add plug-in mechanism to swift-init
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 19:56:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add plug-in mechanism to swift-init

While the plug-in layer for the Swift backend storage processes is being
finalized, intermediate efforts have generally supplanted the top level
executable scripts with custom implementations that will typically deviate
only slightly from the stock implementation.  This approach is both flexible
and effective; however, because it is not well defined it has a side effect of
being incompatible with swift-init.

The optional command line argument --plugin-command-prefix for swift-init will
make it possible for swift-init to manage alternative top level Swift server
executable scripts which are compatible with the stock Swift processes by
appending an alternative prefix to the name of launched script.

For example, if you install an alternative swift-object-replicator
implementation at 'mybackend-object-replicator' you can start the process from
the command line using swift-init's config and pid management with the
command:

    swift-init -p mybackend object-replicator start

Change-Id: I25210b9c3dc6541f2c59be8295c07e9bc21e3881
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-20 23:15:47.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_manager.py', 'swift/common/manager.py', 'bin/swift-init'], 'message': "Add plug-in mechanism to swift-init

While the plug-in layer for the Swift backend storage processes is being
finalized, intermediate efforts have generally supplanted the top level
executable scripts with custom implementations that will typically deviate
only slightly from the stock implementation.  This approach is both flexible
and effective; however, because it is not well defined it has a side effect of
being incompatible with swift-init.

The optional command line argument --plugin-command-prefix for swift-init will
make it possible for swift-init to manage alternative top level Swift server
executable scripts which are compatible with the stock Swift processes by
appending an alternative prefix to the name of launched script.

For example, if you install an alternative swift-object-replicator
implementation at 'mybackend-object-replicator' you can start the process from
the command line using swift-init's config and pid management with the
command:

    swift-init -p mybackend object-replicator start

Change-Id: I25210b9c3dc6541f2c59be8295c07e9bc21e3881
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add plug-in mechanism to swift-init

While the plug-in layer for the Swift backend storage processes is being
finalized, intermediate efforts have generally supplanted the top level
executable scripts with custom implementations that will typically deviate
only slightly from the stock implementation.  This approach is both flexible
and effective; however, because it is not well defined it has a side effect of
being incompatible with swift-init.

The optional command line argument --plugin-command-prefix for swift-init will
make it possible for swift-init to manage alternative top level Swift server
executable scripts which are compatible with the stock Swift processes by
appending an alternative prefix to the name of launched script.

For example, if you install an alternative swift-object-replicator
implementation at 'mybackend-object-replicator' you can start the process from
the command line using swift-init's config and pid management with the
command:

    swift-init -p mybackend object-replicator start

Change-Id: I25210b9c3dc6541f2c59be8295c07e9bc21e3881

commit_message:
chore: remove unneeded statements in wsgi

1. Falcon response's status defaults to 200, no need to set it;
2. Message posting count checking is already covered by input
   validation.

Change-Id: I905dba8bb55e6a4254b2625bb9b71c51496fd2a8

subject: Remove uwsgi requirement
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 16:23:24.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pip-requires'], 'message': "Remove uwsgi requirement

Even though we use uWSGI as our WSGI server for barbican,
we don't have any code dependencies.  It is possible to run
barbican usin gnuicorn or any other WSGI server, so we won't
require uWSGI in the pip-requires file.

Change-Id: Ia0f53cfea18a9c6d8087247c5c58114523437d50
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove uwsgi requirement

Even though we use uWSGI as our WSGI server for barbican,
we don't have any code dependencies.  It is possible to run
barbican usin gnuicorn or any other WSGI server, so we won't
require uWSGI in the pip-requires file.

Change-Id: Ia0f53cfea18a9c6d8087247c5c58114523437d50

subject: API Nodes states
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 11:36:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'API Nodes states

Expose in the API the states a baremetal node can be in (power state,
provision state and transition state) also expose an URI where the user
can control the power state of the node.

THIS PATCH IS A DRAFT, DO NOT MERGE (YET)!

USAGE:

GET nodes/1/state
{
    "provision_state": "active",
    "provision_start": "2013-08-08 10:29:29.900288"
    "power_state": "power on"
    "available_states": ["POWEROFF", "REBOOT"]

commit_message:
API Nodes states

Expose the power state and provision state of a baremetal node in the
API, each state is represented by a separate entity where clients can
GET/PUT value from/to it. A generic /state subresource is also exposed
allowing clients to GET all the current states of that node and links
to each one of the specific states.

Partially implements blueprint state-machine

Change-Id: I0dcea268718dc3bcb152880654631f9fd61295e7

commit_message:
quantum pxeboot-port support for baremetal

Baremetal provisioning currently requires a separate
DHCP server because PXE options are not being set in Neutron.
This feature does not support nova-network, only Neutron.
Implements blueprint pxeboot-ports

Change-Id: I2fefced6ce8ce466f0bc6dc5dd68053fb5827884

commit_message:
db_base_plugin_v2, ipam: introduce ipallocator extension to specify strategy

blueprint: configurable-ip-allocation
As second step, this patch adds ipallocator extension to specify
ip allocation strategy and its parameter. column ip allocation
strategy/parameter column is added to subnets table.

3rd step will be to implement other ip allocation driver like random, LRA,
and exhaust before repeat
The last step will be documentation.

Change-Id: I58637ee17d15eb42b3dfc67eca2b416e3344c1fc

commit_message:
Clean up some unused wrap_exception() stuff

The only use of wrap_exception() without notifier and publisher_id
arguments is in nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py ... and since no notifier
argument is supplied, this decorator does exactly nothing useful. So
let's delete the useless uses of this in the libvirt driver.

Now we can make the notifier and publisher_id the only arguments to the
decorator and make them mandatory, allowing us to clean up some unused
stuff.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I482e7f5e536493c06334b6aefb50c0e48d80c478

commit_message:
set package defaults to present

The package defaults in cinder are set to
latest. This is not consistent with the
other package defaults (which are set to
present).

This patch is aimed at making the package install
state default more consistent across all openstack
packages.

Change-Id: I0551777245acaacb551e84f64c0ef4d80c8c46b0

[{'created': '2013-08-19 15:09:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure REMOTE_USER can contain '@' when using multiple domains

commit_message:
Ensure username passed by REMOTE_USER can contain '@'

The external authentication support allows the domain to be passed
as part of the REMOTE_USER name, by using the '@' as a delineator,
but did not handle the case when the actual username itself also
contained the '@' character.

Fixes bug 1213842

Change-Id: Idffa42fe9c70818c71379669dfcd17d3113738a3

commit_message:
Unified Volume Driver for IBM XIV and IBM DS8K

    * Refactored xiv.py to xiv_ds8k.py
    * Updated tests
    * Updated flags
    * Updated compatibility checks
    * DocImpact
    * Added extend_volume and migrate_volume

implements blueprint ibm-unify-xiv-ds8k

Change-Id: Ifd64fc1dab91ada6fd42a7e92a41361cf220042f

commit_message:
Add UpdatePolicy attribute to Instance/AutoScalingGroup

This is the second part of a series to implement support
for AutoScaling UpdatePolicy.

Defined new update_policy attribute for InstanceGroup
and AutoScalingGroup, and modified init of InstanceGroup and
AutoScalingGroup to parse UpdatePolicy from the template.
Currently, only InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup manages
update using UpdatePolicy and so this is not implemented in the
Resource class. This can be revisited when UpdatePolicy is
applicable to other resource types. The resource validation
method is also overridden here to validate the UpdatePolicy.
Included tests to validate various uses cases of templates
with, with bad, without, and removal of UpdatePolicy. This
patch does not address handling of instances update with
UpdatePolicy yet. The next patch will address that.

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8
blueprint: as-update-policy

Fully qualify form fields (with form name) in YAQL expressions.

This allows to address cleaned data on any wizard step.

Change-Id: Icc1651aeed02784b8a3bde792550efb067af19c9

subject: Fixes all issues of tempest caused by async network allocation
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-17 14:48:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ServerAddressesTestXML.test_list_server_addresses FAIL

The API used by this tempest test relies on instance_info_cache
updated by two threads. The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the info_cache will be consistent.
So wait for two cycles of CONF.heal_instance_info_cache_interval.

Fixes bug #1210483

Change-Id: Ia256bcea41437ee2ffb0b0de9215ce6088bd73ae
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-18 11:38:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ServerAddressesTestXML.test_list_server_addresses FAIL

The API used by this tempest test relies on instance_info_cache
updated by two threads. The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the info_cache will be consistent.
So wait for two cycles of CONF.heal_instance_info_cache_interval.

Fixes bug #1210483

Change-Id: Ia256bcea41437ee2ffb0b0de9215ce6088bd73ae
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-08-19 07:04:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes the issues of tempest due to async network allocation

Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper to alloc network in an
async manner, and this allows one to start querying for
network info before you know you will need it. Nova will
invokes refresh_cache method to update instance_cache_info
after excuting the allocate_for_instance method as well.

But nova rest api will query allocate_for_instance table
directly, thus we will get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the instance_info_cache will be consistent.

The api used in tempest relies on instance_info_cache,
So this patch try retry and timeout in both
wait_for_server_status and list_addresses methods to fix the
issues of tempest due to async network allocation manager.

Fixes bug #1210483

Change-Id: Ia256bcea41437ee2ffb0b0de9215ce6088bd73ae

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-08-19 23:17:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes the issues of tempest due to async network allocation

Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper to alloc network in an

The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the instance_info_cache will be consistent.

The api used in tempest relies on instance_info_cache,
So this patch try retry and timeout in both
wait_for_server_status and list_addresses methods to fix the
issues of tempest due to async network allocation manager.

Beyond that, this patch also fixes other 3 bugs at least:
1, Skip os-fixed-ips test since neutron has not implemented it.
2, 'addr': child.get('version') -> 'addr': child.get('addr')
3, Patch Set 5, remove all "wait_until='BUILD'" when creating
   the server because BUILD is only one suspended middle state,
   it will eventually be ACTIVE.

Fixes bug #1210483

Change-Id: Ia256bcea41437ee2ffb0b0de9215ce6088bd73ae
', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2013-08-20 02:48:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes all issues of tempest caused by async network allocation

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2013-08-21 02:21:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/xml/servers_client.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/servers_client.py'], 'message': 'Fixes all issues of tempest caused by async network allocation

commit_message:
Fixes all issues of tempest caused by async network allocation

Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper to alloc network in an
async manner, and this allows one to start querying for
network info before you know you will need it. Nova will
invokes refresh_cache method to update instance_cache_info
after excuting the allocate_for_instance method as well.

But nova rest api will query allocate_for_instance table
directly, thus we will get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the instance_info_cache will be consistent.

The patch will check network info in the method
wait_for_server_status to fix this issues.

Change-Id: Ia256bcea41437ee2ffb0b0de9215ce6088bd73ae
Closes-Bug: #1210483

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to AggregateMetadata

Added unique constraint
'uniq_aggregate_metadata0aggregate_id0key0deleted'
('aggregate_id', 'key', 'deleted') to
AggregateMetadata model and migrate
scripts.

Exception from UC violation used in method
aggregate_metadata_add() for race condition check.

commit_message:
3PAR driver terminate connection host validation

The 3PAR backend does not allow FQDN host names (i.e. foo.rose.hp.com),
instead it requires just foo without the rose.hp.com. This patch will
now validate the host name in terminate connection by calling
_safe_host just as it was doing in initialize connection when creating
the host on the 3PAR backend.

Change-Id: I52e90938c782473edc93f30672a0530ab5934edc
Fixes: bug 1214994

commit_message:
Pop extra keys from context in from_dict()

RequestContext.to_dict() adds user/tenant keys, but from_dict() spews
this warning a "Arguments dropped when creating context" if you pass a
dict which contains user/tenant keys.

Seems to make perfect sense that from_dict() would remove these extra
keys. A test case ensures this won't happen for new arguments.

This is import for oslo.messaging because we deserialize request context
dicts into nova's RequestContext using from_dict().

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I0938f3c7c581383cbebc3a973d64454250f6ab8e

commit_message:
Don't initialize neutronv2 state at module import

Currently, neutronv2.API defines conductor_api when the module is
imported. This could easily happen before any configuration files are
parsed so e.g. use_local may not be applied.

In the case of oslo.messaging, I was seeing this cause problems bcause
it was happening before oslo.messaging transport was initialized.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ia193442d9c9156b1afdbb24be3c83f4be3c8f35f

commit_message:
Fix fake image_service import in v3 test_disk_config

In one place, we use the full module path for the image.fake module and
in another place we simply use 'fake', however we only import the
latter. This appears to only work because of the common.rpc import which
results in nova.tests.image.fake being defined. This import is going
away with oslo.messaging, though.

It looks like we use a mixture of approaches across the tests, so go
with the full path approach.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ida4c9e261a99d0610b557ba46c9f56927af21fef

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 00:10:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Put fault message in the correct field

Currently when adding an instance fault, the message field looks
for kwargs['value'], which many exceptions do not have.  This
results in the message field being set to the name of the
exception class, which in some cases is not useful (see the bug
report for an example).

This change puts the exception message in the message field, and
removes it from the details field since there's no need to put it
in both places.  That leaves the details field for actual details,
like stack traces.

Fixes bug 1203880

Change-Id: Ic92a9bd9cb2e139ce7a9f3f1299b7a6ccae82dd1

commit_message:
Put fault message in the correct field

Currently when adding an instance fault, the message field looks
for kwargs['value'], which many exceptions do not have.  This
results in the message field being set to the name of the
exception class, which in some cases is not useful (see the bug
report for an example).

This change puts the exception message in the message field, and
removes it from the details field since there's no need to put it
in both places.  That leaves the details field for actual details,
like stack traces.

Fixes bug 1203880

Change-Id: Ic92a9bd9cb2e139ce7a9f3f1299b7a6ccae82dd1

commit_message:
Relax policy so owner can access encryption info

The admin only policy is too restrictive to allow Nova to access a
volume's encryption metadata using the owner's request context. Hence,
this commit relaxes the policy for the volume encryption metadata
API extension so the metadata is accessible to the volume's owner.

Implements: blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes
Change-Id: Ia946850b79f7f717ab7528caf7cac2905e650917
SecurityImpact

commit_message:
Fix prep_resize() stale system_metadata issue

In compute manager, the _prep_resize() method can clobber the
caller's instance['system_metadata'] if it is in dict format,
and leave's the caller's instance object stale after an update.
This seemingly obscure fix isn't hit until the next patch where
we actually have a way to encounter this specific situation.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I4b3a20c483dd632149c7808daf4986c00dc72890

subject: Fix incorrect msgstr's to avoid translation errors
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 19:52:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary msgstr's from English po files

The English translations had translated message strings
specified.  This is unnecessary as there is no need to
translate English to English and the bigger problem was the
fact that there were many cases where the translated string
was incomplete or the wrong string all together.

This commit fixes this problem for the en_US, en_AU and en_GB
locales.  The msgstr is now set to "" .  This will cause the
translation to be skipped and the English msgid will be used instead.

Fixes bug #1209317

Change-Id: Ia78f5ebb4bec996798798bb25ea1b97c47b5e50b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-14 21:23:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary msgstr's from English po files

The English translations had translated message strings
specified.  This is unnecessary as there is no need to
translate English to English and the bigger problem was the
fact that there were many cases where the translated string
was incomplete or the wrong string all together.

This commit fixes this problem for the en_US, en_AU and en_GB
locales.  The msgstr is now set to "" .  This will cause the
translation to be skipped and the English msgid will be used instead.

Fixes bug #1209317

Change-Id: Ia78f5ebb4bec996798798bb25ea1b97c47b5e50b
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-08-21 22:06:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/locale/en_GB/LC_MESSAGES/cinder.po', 'cinder/locale/en_US/LC_MESSAGES/cinder.po', 'cinder/locale/en_AU/LC_MESSAGES/cinder.po'], 'message': "Fix incorrect msgstr's to avoid translation errors

There are numerous msgstr's in the cinder.po files for en_US,
en_AU and en_GB that are incorrect translations of the associated
msgid.  It appears that there are a number that are the result of
problems with past fuzzy translations gone wrong and some may also be the
result of copy/paste mistakes.  Regardless of the origin it makes debug and
development very difficult if the string that is coming out in the
logs doesn't match what is expected.  This patch fixes the numerous
bad msgstr's.

Once this commit is merged, Transifex will catch the change to
the Cinder po files and then spin a new Transifex Translations import.

commit_message:
Fix incorrect msgstr's to avoid translation errors

There are numerous msgstr's in the cinder.po files for en_US,
en_AU and en_GB that are incorrect translations of the associated
msgid.  It appears that there are a number that are the result of
problems with past fuzzy translations gone wrong and some may also be the
result of copy/paste mistakes.  Regardless of the origin it makes debug and
development very difficult if the string that is coming out in the
logs doesn't match what is expected.  This patch fixes the numerous
bad msgstr's.

Once this commit is merged, Transifex will catch the change to
the Cinder po files and then spin a new Transifex Translations import.

Fixes bug #1209317

Change-Id: Ia78f5ebb4bec996798798bb25ea1b97c47b5e50b

commit_message:
Cleanup: Add common "create security rule" method

There are many "create security rule" methods in each scenario test,
their behaviors are almost the same. They create security rule which
is loginable/reachable to a server with ssh/ping.
For code-cleanup, this patch adds the method which creates loginable
rules to the specified security group.

Change-Id: I4e2ebd099b7373948c82abf86615a85db055c7c5

commit_message:
Improve help message of loadbalancer commands

- Correct the help for healthmonitor type (Fixes bug #1203582)
- Use choices for the enum fields:
  healthmonitor type, pool lb-method, pool protocol
- Convert metavar to uppercase

Change-Id: I2a648949b48385249dde0c5868f564e1f17c3675

commit_message:
Use the global environment to define AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm

This will make it easier for the deployer to define the default
implementation.

Change-Id: If1a8dceb4ad2cade90a56f16dd450e571425c4a6

commit_message:
Load deployer/global environment files at startup

This allows for a global environment that the deployer can use to set
their own defaults.
An example /etc/heat/environment.d/x.yaml

resource_registry:
  "OS::Quantum*": "OS::Neutron*"
  "AWS::RDS::DBInstance": "file:///etc/heat/templates/AWS_RDS_DBInstance.template"

Change-Id: Iee647a109e5a41d41cd4a79909c6edaca0d17b87

commit_message:
Add an environment_format.py like the template one

This to make the section checking mechanism less spread out
and more consistent. This can also be used by the global
environment loader.

Change-Id: I7ca7ad754fb702877dedc416a30f573d239933ad

commit_message:
Remove calls to policy.check and policy.enforce from plugin code

Completes blueprint make-authz-orthogonal

This patch removes a few explicit policy checks recently added to
the plumgrid and cisco plugins.
They are not necessary as the same checks are already performed
by the policy engine.

Change-Id: Ie99f5fa6ad4a9568b050827bc479a62dd40e18ac
